item.title: Connecting a real C64 in 2019
item.description: Power Supply Replacing the power supply for a C64 is one of the most critical steps to ensuring it’s survival. Any 35+ year old power unit would be a cause for concern but the C64’s is particulalrly dangerous. The original power supplies were built cheap and lack any form of over-volatge protection. This means they have a high failure rate and such a failure is likely to fry your pride and joy.

item.title: History of the C64
item.description: The Commodore 64 (C64) is an 8-bit home computer introduced in January 1982 by Commodore International. The combination of clever technology and innovative sales strategies helped to make it the highest-selling single computer model of all time with independent estimates placing the number sold between 10 and 17 million units. The C64 dominated the low-end computer market for most of the 1980s and introduced a whole generation of people to the idea of a home computer.
